file_content.text: Give those records to Captain Nelex. He'll set you right.
What do you think Master Tykan was studying?
Why did Tykan want them?
No idea. But I'd find out fast.
Thanks, but I should go.
Don't have anymore disasters while I'm gone.
Keep an eye on this place.
We'll take care. You do the same, Jedi.
You're back. And in one piece.
Hope you didn't breathe too much of that stuff. We got the whole crew out, thanks to you.
Might take months for us to start clearing the pollution again, though. A lot of people are gonna get sick.
Trust in the Force. You and your men will get this place running again.
You'll recover from this.
That's true. One crazy Jedi won't knock us back for long.
I wish there had been another way, but Tykan didn't give me a choice.
I'm sorry.
Hey, I'm not blaming you.
I came here to catch a rogue Jedi. I can't get sidetracked by this.
My focus is Tykan.
You're damn right.
The Junction's looking good, too. All systems are up and running--great job.
But we lost a lot of people. Our best maintenance crew, most of the labor force... gone.
The deaths of so many are hard to bear.
I regret their loss.
The Junction will help save the people of Taris. Wouldn't your men have chosen that?
It was the right decision.
Likely, yes. Just get that crazy Jedi. For them.
There's no time to grieve. I have to find Tykan.
Tykan's my priority.
I hear that.
Tykan's the one responsible for this. Maybe we can help you stop him. Here.
Before he lost it, Tykan was studying the old Taris infrastructure. These are the records he copied. But the encryption is pretty old. We can't decipher 'em.
Someone around here must be able to decrypt them.
Who can?
We tend to focus more on languages at the Jedi Temple.
Not my area of expertise.
Then it's a good thing we've got an alternative.
What's the point of giving them to me if they're encoded?
So they're useless.
The Republic base's computers should have the original codes; they'll get those records open nice and quick.
Welcome to the Junction, Jedi. Sorry, we, uh, didn't have time to clean up.
I'm hearing some funny rumors from my guys, about Master Tykan. That why you're here?
I can't discuss this, but I must find Master Tykan at once.
He needs my help.
He didn't say when he'd be back. What's wrong?
Is there a way to get your crew out of this building quickly?
We must evacuate. Quietly.
Could run a fire drill, I guess. Look, what's going on here?
Tykan attacked a research party, and made threats against the Junction.
He talked about killing you.
Are you serious? Why would he do that?
Here you are. Hiding in tunnels? Hah! I see your eyes shining! They... stop whispering! I am a Jedi! I am! This changes nothing!
Such a dark planet, rock spires like fingers, black rock that--wait! The darkness flows from them! It must!
Master Tykan? Can you hear me? I've come to heal you of this sickness.
Let me help you.
Heal? Or... hurt? I see the lies in you!
Yes, Master Tykan. Come down and we'll find out together.
Of course it does, Master.
Together? Like in the dark place long ago.
If I ended up like you, I'd beg to be put out of my misery.
This is sad.
There was a place where things ended. A dark place of endings.
I watched once, in the dark place... Malachor was dark, then bright. I watch his eyes as we run. As Parkanas falls alone.
Whatever you're hearing or seeing, it's not real. You're just ill.
You're hallucinating.
Tell me about Parkanas, Master Tykan. What do you remember?
Parkanas, again.
You're Cin Tykan, a Jedi Master. Now snap out of it!
I won't indulge this!
Stop it! Stop it! My friend--no, I won't go back there!
I'll stop all of you! And your Junction--hoarding poisons like a leech. Yes!
I'll free the gasses you've stolen. And the shadows from underground. Your Junction will be dust around you!
What would Aris say if she saw you like this, Master Tykan?
Think of your Padawan.
One was very bright. Yuon? Sidonie? No, that's wrong.
There's no need, Master. The Force can cleanse you of this fear.
You don't have to do this.
You'd like me to think that, wouldn't you?
If you really want to kill somebody, come try your luck with me.
Face me, first.
There is no luck, young Tykan. We are Jedi, guided by the Force.
What will the Jedi do while the gas builds, hmm? Will it save the workers before they choke and die?
But the gas will corrode the Junction, too. How many will die without it to cleanse the planet? Thousands? How many do you want to kill?
Uhhh! Can you smell that? That maniac's busted the main gas line!
Sir! Rakghouls! Someone's breaking open the vents, rakghouls are pouring in!
No! We... we need to focus on evacuating or... save the Junction... I don't know!
Don't panic. The Junction's workers are relying on us to save them.
Let's help the workers.
The Force will aid us, but I need your help. What's our best course of action?
Give me some advice.
I'll evacuate our--wait! I got a crew doing maintenance behind a blast door. They'll be choking on the gas by now!
Please, I can't send anyone else back there. You're their only chance.
Get them on their feet and out before the rakghouls reach that section. Good luck!
This facility is critical to the restoration of Taris. We have to repair it.
The Junction must be saved.
There's an emergency valve that would purge the gas, but it's right by the vents. It'll be crawling with rakghouls.
But if you can risk it, that valve might save the Junction. It's in this section.
Jedi or not, I've seen what those rakghouls can do. I'll try getting the others out--you be careful!
Holiday, can you decrypt these records for me?
Holiday could do it.
Oooh, let me see. Hmm... sorry. This military encryption is completely passe. My software might wipe the records.
